qas.question: How much of the entire population of the planet is estimated to be carrying tuberculosis?
How many cases of tuberculosis were active over the course of 2014?
In 2014, how many people died from TB?
Does the majority of fatalities from TB occur in developing countries or industrialized nations?
Has TB infection increased or decreased worldwide since the start of the 21st century?
What percentage of deaths worldwide died from TB in 2014?
How many people died from TB in 2000?
How many new cases of TB occurred in 2014?
Which Asian country has an 80% infection rate?

context: <a0_0>One-third<a0_0/> of the world's population is thought to be infected with TB. New infections occur in about 1% of the population each year. In 2014, there were <a1_0><b7_0>9.6 million<b7_0/><a1_0/> cases of active TB which resulted in <a2_0><b6_0>1.5 million<b6_0/><a2_0/> deaths. More than <b5_0>95%<b5_0/> of deaths occurred in <a3_0>developing countries<a3_0/>. The number of new cases each year has <a4_0>decreased<a4_0/> since <b8_0>2000<b8_0/>. About 80% of people in many Asian and African countries test positive while 5–10% of people in the <b9_0>United States<b9_0/> population tests positive by the tuberculin test. Tuberculosis has been present in humans since ancient times.
